Yes I DID! There is so much political issues on racism these days. And I get it! These boys are doing an awesome thing! And I myself don't want them or any other race to think all other races are against them! With the world as it is, we all need to know we are lived and appreciated NO MATTER WHAT!!! I'm sorry if my comment offended you, but we as THE HUMAN RACE, should start showing a little more appreciation for THE HUMAN RACE instead of diversity. Just wanted them to know I appreciate them and what they are doing and that WE AS ANY COLOR ARE NOT AGAINST THEM FOR THEIR COLOR! These are good boys doing a good thing and I thank them! More kids should be out doing the same! I have no intentions on getting into a heated discussion w/ you or anyone else! GOOD JOB BOYS KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK!

Er... Leslie i don't think you're right. Before you keel over with anger. 1. If a man wore that his balls would hang out - that was where I was going. Just because her vagina doesn't fall out, I still find it indecent. It's an inappropriate garment full stop. It's not a matter of masculine / feminine for me - it's just plain inappropriate. 2. I've no problem with men wearing skirts or make up in public and I know no one who would. I have no issue with fluid gender - my experience across the U.K. is that if you're a nice person, no one cares. (Maybe different in schools!?). Maybe we're more liberal than you guys in the USA. That said if men chose to wear skirts etc, they - like women - have to be a socially acceptable length. That's to say his balls and arse aren't to hanging out. That IS important here. You may call it old fashioned, I call it common decency. 3. Mulan, Disney film for kids. She is referred to as a 'cross dresser'. So no, it's not only applied to men. So I think your anger is a bit misplaced and you've turned a gender less comment on appropriateness of attire into a wider debate on gender....

Sally: Don't you think a couple decades of war and rampant xenophobia have already done a pretty good job of inflaming that issue? I'd say multiple military campaigns through that region and the resultant fear and instability give them plenty to work with. And no, I don't think that he has been used in any official capacity in ISIS propaganda videos. You know why I think that? There has been no evidence found of him being used in such a way. There just hasn't been any as of yet. Perhaps some will crop up after all this hubbub, but that doesn't negate the fact that the statement was """"mistakenly untrue"""" at best when said and a """"complete fabrication designed to attack Trump head on"""" at worst. Again, if we put the shoe on the other foot, we'd probably be gleefully collecting signatures to force a public apology.
